title: What are the consequences of Joe Biden ruling America and Donald Trump ruling America? - Quora
tags: Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Well, first of all Biden has no plans to “rule” the US - he hopes to be President, not a ruler. Trump does want to “rule” the US. As a communist-style President for Life dictator. So your use of the word “rule” applies only to Trump. That being said, lets do Trumps plan for healthcare: 200 dollar cards for seniors on Medicare for prescriptions - how great is that, right? Except that the 200 dollars will be totally gone after the first couple of refills. And since there has been no money put forward to pay for these, what, exactly, is Trumps plan to pay for these cards? A mystery. Getting rid of the ACA. Which will throw about 20 to 24 million people off healthcare coverage of any sort, AND get rid of pre-existing conditions being covered. How great is that, right? Got high blood pressure? Your premiums just skyrocketed, or you might get turned down if you’re hunting for insurance once the ACA has been done away with, or you might lose your existing coverage. Got migraines? Got high cholesterol? Got arthritis? Again, your premiums just skyrocketed, or you get turned down by the insurance companies, or you lose your existing insurance - because you have what the insurance companies deem “a pre-existing condition”. So, what do you do? Republicans say “who cares?” We got rid the ACA didn’t we? That’s what you wanted, that’s what you voted for when you voted for us. So just be quiet. You got what you wanted.” Obviously Biden has a rather more sympathetic plan - not a medicare for all, but a plan to build on the ACA, thereby keeping coverage for those with pre-existing conditions, and allowing 20 to 24 million people to actually keep the insurance they are paying for. The list of consequences for a Biden Presidency compared with a Trump Presidency begins and ends with healthcare. Which one would you choose where your family members are concerned?
